page.title: 03CONSERVATION IN STEWARTON
page.content: The area is conscious of the needs of conservation and on the whole is unspoiled by litter.The Annick Water used to have no fish in it in the town of Stewarton but now that there are controls on effluent from factories and houses and a new sewerage plant the river is clean and is used by anglers who catch trout and sometimes sea trout and salmon.Rights of way and footpaths in the town and countryside are maintained by Kilmarnock and Loudoun District Council and Dean Park Ranger Service.Many wild plants and animals abound in the area.
